metadata.synopsis: Volo is being publically executed in the docs by some agitators in front of an angry mob. Volo is tied to a chair on a cart full of explosives, the trail of alcohol leads to it from the angry mob. The agitator has the torch in his hands and drops it on the trail of alcohol in the end of the dialog.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of execution in the Docks, in front of the Steelwatch Foundry at approximately: -229; 4; -160

15.speaker: Volo
15.text: It's not a lie! If you would just listen - I can explain!
15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: An angry mob is gathered around a dockyard cart on which Volo is tied up, struggling. 
SFX of angry crowd clamouring in background. No specific words needed.

22.speaker: Churg Elvek
22.text: You have done quite enough 'explaining', Volothamp Geddarm.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The crowd goes quiet to listen to the 'sermon'-like speech of the agitator.

0.speaker: Churg Elvek
0.text: You have poisoned the very hearts and minds of these good, kind, gentle citizens, with your lies. Your delusions. Your conspiracies.

14.speaker: Churg Elvek
14.text: Though you hide behind a mask of stories, we have seen beyond the veil. We see what you really are - fearmonger.

29.speaker: Saff Fargoer
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering of the same line from the crowd.

49.speaker: Saff Fargoer
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering of the same line from the crowd.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Your parasite stirs in recognition. This man is infected.*

45.speaker: Saff Fargoer
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering - this is the only line discernible.

7.speaker: Churg Elvek
7.text: Today, citizens, we rid ourselves of this cankerous sore. Today, we burn away all falsehoods. Today, we will be divided no longer, for today we rise in TRUTH!
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Crowd cheers in agreement and bloodlust when he's done. NodeContext: His fervor rising with every phrase.

47.speaker: Minsc
47.text: This man is no enemy of the people! This man could not even hurt a mouse! I know - I have seen him try!

13.speaker: Churg Elvek
13.text: What's this? Another heretic in our midst?

54.speaker: Churg Elvek
54.text: Another mind, clouded by the disruptor's lies. Another soul to cleanse.

10.speaker: Volo
10.text: Psst - don't just stand there. Help me goddsdammit. HELP ME.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Volo addresses the player from where he's boundNodeContext: hissed desperate whisper

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: We're not going to let this happen, are we? Volo's... well, he's Volo.
23.context: NodeContext: Doesn't have a strong reason to save him but she still wants to.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.text: Of course we'll save you, Volo. I think this mob has made the rather silly mistake of taking you seriously.
3.context: NodeContext: Amused to see her old fraudulent friend on trial in front of a mob - but mostly because she's confident we'll step in to stop it

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Volo has done no harm - you, on the other hand, serve the Absolute.

35.speaker: Churg Elvek
35.text: What's this? The opportune wielding of a weapon?

32.speaker: Churg Elvek
32.text: It seems, dear citizens, that we have a HERETIC in our midst.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: He addresses the crowd.NodeContext: as if sharing with the crowd a great joke

16.speaker: Churg Elvek
16.text: Well we are nothing if not gracious. Let us see if we cannot lift the veil from their eyes too!

21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The agitator raises a torch over the trail of alcohol leading to Volo's cart full of explosives.

We can show just the raising of the torch, leaving the trail and vart off shot

46.speaker: Volo
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Agitator raises torch about to drop it onto flammable surface. (The actual drop happens in gameplay.)NodeContext: Volo is about to be set on fire

39.speaker: Player
39.text: What crime is this man guilty of? If he is guilty, where's the evidence? Where's the trial? This isn't justice - this is mob madness!

50.speaker: Churg Elvek
50.text: The newcomer speaks! And speaks of evidence, and trials, and justice.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Agitator addresses the crowd, referencing the player.

20.speaker: Churg Elvek
20.text: And in so doing, they delay their very own salvation.

52.speaker: Churg Elvek
52.text: Dear citizen, dear friend, rest assured you will have your justice, but I'm afraid the time for trials has passed. Now is the time for judgement.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: He addresses the player directly. NodeContext: Sickly sweet at first, fire and brimstone on the last line

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Well go on then, do whatever it is you're planning to do to him.

6.speaker: Volo
6.text: No - No - please - no... I take it back!

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You would kill a man for spinning yarns? For telling stories? Please, this is ridiculous.

5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
5.text: This promises to be an amusing spectacle. Let us see if death can silence Volo at last.
5.context: NodeContext: amused, preparing to watch Volo die by mob justice. He's worthless to her, so she genuinely finds it an amusing spectacle

25.speaker: Lae'zel
25.text: A madman Volo may be, but I see no reason to blow him up over it.

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: By the gods, do something. Or are you going to let them blow up the poor guy?

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: I suppose we should aid him... though I'd hate to miss the show.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: I really think we ought to step in here. Whatever his crime, this punishment is surely an overcorrection.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: This damsel may be middle-aged, but let's get him out of distress.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: Perhaps we should aid him - he is an old friend, after all. Or at least... an old acquaintance.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Poor guy looks like he could really use a hand. I've got two, hey?
55.context: NodeContext: 'Let's help him, I volunteer as tribute.'

11.speaker: Jaheira
11.text: Come, let us free the bard from his adoring fans. And their rather accurate charges.
11.context: NodeContext: Amused to see her old fraudulent friend on trial in front of a mob - but mostly because she's confident we'll step in to stop it

31.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
31.text: This promises to be an amusing spectacle, and the accused is guilty of offending my ears at the very least.
31.context: NodeContext: amused, preparing to watch Volo die by mob justice. He's worthless to her, so she genuinely finds it an amusing spectacle

30.speaker: Lae'zel
30.text: I won't keep you from helping. But an explosion sounds far more entertaining.

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: Volothamp Geddarm? By the gods, do something!

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I suppose we should aid him... though I'd hate to miss the show.

17.speaker: Gale
17.text: I really think we ought to step in here. Whatever his crime, this punishment is surely an overcorrection.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: This damsel may be middle-aged, but let's get him out of distress.

1.speaker: Halsin
1.text: Perhaps we should aid him - though we risk angering the crowd if we do.
